pullRequest.body:
Defines what it means for a triple of morphisms `f g : X ‚ü∂ Y`, `Œπ : W ‚ü∂ X` to be a split equalizer. In addition, shows that every split equalizer is an equalizer and absolute.

This dualises everything in [Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Shapes.SplitCoequalizer](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Shapes/SplitCoequalizer.html).

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing Algebraic Geometry" in June 2024.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [acae65ca35](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14170/commits/acae65ca35d12962e1209c185b2518e19f259fea)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasSplitEqualizer`
`+ HasSplitEqualizer.equalizerOfSplit`
`+ HasSplitEqualizer.equalizerŒπ`
`+ HasSplitEqualizer.isSplitEqualizer`
`+ IsSplitEqualizer`
`+ IsSplitEqualizer.asFork`
`+ IsSplitEqualizer.asFork_Œπ`
`+ IsSplitEqualizer.isEqualizer`
`+ IsSplitEqualizer.map`
`+ instance (priority := 1) hasEqualizer_of_hasSplitEqualizer [HasSplitEqualizer f g] :`
`+ instance {X : C} : Inhabited (IsSplitEqualizer (ùüô X) (ùüô X) (ùüô X))`
`+ map_is_cosplit_pair`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>
bors d+

:v: mckoen can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9749616433/job/26907185213)
Canceled.
What is the situation with this PR?

> What is the situation with this PR?

I'm not sure, I thought it was okay to merge but it was cancelled for some reason. I'm not very familiar with Bors so maybe I did something wrong
Something failed, can you merge master and see what's wrong?

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9766767057/job/26960460417)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9766767057/job/26960460848)
Can we get rid of this `@`? Similarly below, and in the other file.
I did this in both files.

This def should be called `HasSplitEqualizer.equalizer` or something like that, as it has nothing to do with `CosplitPair`. I guess it's adapted from the other file, in which case that should be changed too.

Ok, I changed this name to `HasSplitEqualizer.equalizerOfSplit`, and didn't touch it in the other file. The `Split` in the name in the other file doesn't refer to `Functor.IsSplitPair`, hence we shouldn't use `Cosplit here.

```suggestion
`CategoryTheory.IsSplitEqualizer.isEqualizer`.
```
Maybe the other file as well?
